Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of External Stenting in Saphenous Vein Graft Failure Prevention

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive either external stenting or standard care.

Participants.evidence: Participants were patients undergoing CABG with at least two planned SVGs. Eligibility criteria included adults with multivessel coronary artery disease.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive either external stenting or standard care.

Objective.evidence: To assess the effect of external stenting on SVG failure rates.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was SVG failure at 12 months, defined as >50% stenosis on angiography.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed using sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 200 participants were randomised: 100 to the intervention group and 100 to the control group.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Analysis was conducted on 98 participants in the intervention group and 97 in the control group using an intention-to-treat approach.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The intervention group showed a significant reduction in SVG failure (mean difference = 10%, 95% CI 5% to 15%; p = 0.01).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were reported in 3% of the intervention group and 1% of the control group, with mild severity.

Funding.evidence: Funding: Supported by the National Institutes of Health.
